metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14325 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
In ImageMagick 7.0.7-1 Q16, a memory leak vulnerability was found in thefunction PersistPixelCache in magick/cache.c, which allows attackers tocause a denial of service (memory consumption in ReadMPCImage incoders/mpc.c) via a crafted file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14325` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
imagemagick-common - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagick++5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagickcore5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagickcore5-extra - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagickwand5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
perlmagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11').
